result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Duane Hadlock

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
8:44 AM Defendant Charles Duane Hadlock in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Charles Duane Hadlock.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Katie Garrett, sworn and testifies
Sex Offender Registry agent for Wisconsin DOC
Defendant required to register for life for a conviction in Douglas County WI

Attorney  Hoffman cross examines witness

State calls Ronald Robinson, sworn and testifies
Patrol officer City of Superior Police Department.
On duty 9/25/22 responded to address on Ogden Ave Superior WI Douglas County
Witness identifies defendant
Attorney has no response
Record reflects identification of defendant

Attorney Hoffman has no cross

State has no additional witnesses, requests to screen share proposed exhibit 1 Certified copy of JOC 94CF113-moves for admission. Attorney Hoffman has no objection to exhibit admission.  Exhibit received.

State final comments
Defense final comments

Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for arraignment. 
Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.
State's Proposed Prelim Ex 1 - CERT JOC 94CF113

10:15 AM Defendant Charles Duane Hadlock in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Charles Duane Hadlock.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State has witness availability issue. Not opposed to rescheduling. State indicates witness should be available next week.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:45 am.

1:29 PM Defendant Charles Duane Hadlock in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Charles Duane Hadlock.  Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Court notes failure to appear at prelim yesterday.  Based on appearance, Court quashes warrant. Questions why defendant didn't appear. Indicates he had times mixed up.
State recommends $1000 forfeited be reinstated, requests additional $500 cash. 
Court makes note that he did show up yesterday, just at a later time. Court reinstates $1000 cash bail, no additional cash ordered. Court sets date.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.

9:02 AM Defendant Charles Duane Hadlock not in court. Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Charles Duane Hadlock. Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney Hoffman has no information on defendant's nonappearance. States witnesses also appear in person and on zoom. Upon defendants failure to appear, State requests warrant and forfeiture of any bond. Court grants warrant and forfeiture of any bond previously ordered.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Charles Duane Hadlock
Current: 1514 Ogden Ave Apt 13, Superior, WI 54880 United States  (Effective: 09-27-2022)
Prior: 1527 Hammond Avenue, Apt 1, Superior, WI 54880
Comply with sex offender registry requirements.

3:22 PM Defendant Charles Duane Hadlock appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Hoffman making special appearance. Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court quashes warrant. Defendant's address updated and amended on complaint 1514 Ogden Avenue, Apt 13 Superior WI. Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Not guilty plea(s) entered. 
State requesting 1500cb comply with Sex offender registry requirements. reviews criminal history; no fta's.  Concerning charge is 1994 case.
Attorney Hoffman makes argument opposing bail request.
Court questions defendant on intent re counsel.  Defendant believes he will lose his job making him eligible for PD.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
